div.p: Nilus to Thalia, greetings. I acquired the small cheeses through Antoninus, and you will know as I was grieving having read the sealed letter. And now, although I wrote what the certain thing was two months earlier, you write, “I received your other letters in which you write nothing.” These things therefore have passed by. For if I should find anyone genuine, it will be sent to you. And prepare to send me all even the olives. Write to me concerning which you lack knowing that I do not neglect. The beautiful Agathopous greets, even if he also(?) does not write to us. I pray for your health, my lady sister.
Greet the beautiful Agathus Daemon. Learn the earnestness which he has done for your friend although she has spent upon nothing.
To Thalia Nilus. Translation: J.-L. Calvo Martinez, P.Oxy. 67 4626
